<content xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" type="html"><h2>Image search becomes even better !</h2>

<p>We're excited to roll out major upgrades to our image search. This release includes:</p>

<ul><li>Our image search became even better with the <strong>inclusion of two more sources</strong>:  <a href="https://yandex.com/images/" rel="ugc nofollow">Yandex Image Search</a> (widely recognized as one of best image search services) and <a href="https://openverse.org" rel="ugc nofollow">Openverse</a> (vast collection of openly licensed images). Kagi is doing the hard work so that you don't have to.</li></ul>


<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-11-19/1732048048-363540-image.png" title="" alt=""></p>


<ul><li>Enhanced <strong>generative AI image detection</strong> and flagging (first version of which we launched last month)</li></ul>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-17/1729194595-631881-image-search-ai-labelf8dce12e.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<ul><li>A revamped preview pane with included <strong>reverse image search</strong> functionality</li></ul>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-11-19/1732050443-494504-screenshot-2024-11-19-at-125950.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>With this we believe we can say that Kagi has the most powerful image search on the web.</p>

<h2>FastFeedParser - high performance library for processing feeds</h2>

<p>We open sourced <a href="https://github.com/kagisearch/fastfeedparser" rel="ugc nofollow">FastFeedParser</a>, a high performance RSS, Atom and RDF parser in Python.</p>

<p>This library powers <a href="https://github.com/kagisearch/smallweb" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Small Web</a> and a few other initiatives at Kagi and is 10x-100x faster and more efficient at parsing feeds than existing alternatives.</p>

<p>FastFeedParser joins over a dozen Kagi <a href="https://github.com/kagisearch" rel="ugc nofollow">open-source software projects</a>.</p>

<h1>Improvements and Bug Fixes</h1>

<h2>Kagi Translate</h2>

<p>Two weeks ago we launched <a href="https://blog.kagi.com/kagi-translate" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Translate</a> to <a href="https://x.com/KagiHQ/status/1858893878167785825" rel="ugc nofollow">raving reviews</a> and great reception.</p>

<p>We have a number of improvements and more is scheduled.</p>

<ul><li>Added PWA manifest so you can add Kagi Translate your home screen while we are developing the app</li>
<li>Switch language button also switches text</li>
<li>Fixed parsing for some websites in Translate <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/kdh8219" class="UserMention">@kdh8219</a> </li>
<li>Fixed unicode/Japanese issues <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Kate-Karui" class="UserMention">@Kate-Karui</a> </li>
<li>Support for bangs/translating with just URL params <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/christophe" class="UserMention">@christophe</a> </li>
<li>Skip translating code blocks <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/imlonghao" class="UserMention">@imlonghao</a> </li>
<li>Fix: character counter </li>
<li>Fix: clicked links on a translated page do not lead anywhere</li>
<li>Fix: links not working on translated pages</li>
<li>Fix: Translate auth in Android app</li>
<li>Fix: Pr﻿о﻿b﻿l﻿е﻿m﻿ѕ﻿ w﻿h﻿е﻿n﻿ і﻿t﻿ dеt﻿есt﻿ѕ﻿ t﻿h﻿е﻿ ѕ﻿а﻿m﻿е﻿ l﻿а﻿n﻿g﻿u﻿а﻿g﻿е﻿ аѕ tа﻿r﻿gе﻿t</li></ul>

<h2>Kagi Search</h2>
<ul><li>You can now set the search bar at the bottom of your mobile screen. To change this setting, go to <strong>Settings &gt; Appearance</strong> on your mobile device. <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3749" data-id="3749" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3749</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/raphty" class="UserMention">@raphty</a><br>
<img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-11-15/1731698973-904742-image.png" title="" alt=""></li>
<li>Safari Zooms to Text Field when Selected <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/1505" data-id="1505" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#1505</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/KFCPredator" class="UserMention">@KFCPredator</a></li>
<li>Accessibility issues <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/2923" data-id="2923" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#2923</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/darekkay" class="UserMention">@darekkay</a></li>
<li>News tab: No results or visible elements <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5375" data-id="5375" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5375</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/dunxen" class="UserMention">@dunxen</a></li>
<li>Kagi Maps - Nearby Attractions arrow inverted? <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4655" data-id="4655" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4655</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/kaij" class="UserMention">@kaij</a></li>
<li>Date filter not working <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/2900" data-id="2900" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#2900</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Value7609" class="UserMention">@Value7609</a></li>
<li>Horizontal scrollbar on mobile homepage <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5337" data-id="5337" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5337</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/fxgn" class="UserMention">@fxgn</a></li>
<li>Links in maps info box hard to read <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4684" data-id="4684" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4684</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/ac3xx" class="UserMention">@ac3xx</a></li>
<li>FastGPT bangs and queries via URL don't work <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5365" data-id="5365" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5365</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Peter" class="UserMention">@Peter</a></li>
<li>Discrepancy in billing pages <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4617" data-id="4617" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4617</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/joystmp" class="UserMention">@joystmp</a></li>

<li>Fix Accidental API Payments <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5181" data-id="5181" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5181</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Kate-Karui" class="UserMention">@Kate-Karui</a></li>
<li>Order by Time doesn’t work <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/1176" data-id="1176" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#1176</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/danny" class="UserMention">@danny</a></li>
<li>Translate language selction dropdown hard to read. <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5301" data-id="5301" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5301</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/adisibio" class="UserMention">@adisibio</a></li>
<li>"Helsingfors" Wikipedia widget contains a bunch of "&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;"'s <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3411" data-id="3411" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3411</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Vapid" class="UserMention">@Vapid</a></li>

<li>Snaps do not work with custom bangs <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5381" data-id="5381" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5381</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/testry" class="UserMention">@testry</a></li>
<li>Add alt text to favicons on search page <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5249" data-id="5249" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5249</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a>  </li>
<li>When searching with <code>site:reddit.com</code>, some Reddit search results don't have titles <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4601" data-id="4601" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4601</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/neysofu" class="UserMention">@neysofu</a></li>
<li>Double quotes ignored when using lenses <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4787" data-id="4787" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4787</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/barker03" class="UserMention">@barker03</a></li>
<li>When a bang is for kagi.com but has an ad value: use that for favicon <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5227" data-id="5227" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5227</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a> </li>
<li>Reply on "What's the date" <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3931" data-id="3931" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3931</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/yeri" class="UserMention">@yeri</a> </li>
<li>Site:&lt;tld&gt; filtering not working / as expected (anymore) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4656" data-id="4656" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4656</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/jbattermann" class="UserMention">@jbattermann</a></li>
<li>Quick Answer Issue <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4492" data-id="4492" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4492</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Rudotel" class="UserMention">@Rudotel</a></li>
<li>Uploading Does Not Work For Assistant On Android App <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5126" data-id="5126" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5126</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/emphatic361" class="UserMention">@emphatic361</a></li>
<li>Android app light mode not working <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5020" data-id="5020" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5020</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Peter_S" class="UserMention">@Peter_S</a></li>

<li>Uploading Does Not Work For Assistant On Android App <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5126" data-id="5126" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5126</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/emphatic361" class="UserMention">@emphatic361</a></li>
<li>Keyboard doesn't auto popup when opening search from widget android <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4968" data-id="4968" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4968</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/agustinfitipaldi" class="UserMention">@agustinfitipaldi</a></li></ul>

<h2>The Assistant</h2>

<li>When using the new assistant page, if "web access" is selected, it says "something went wrong" <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4720" data-id="4720" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4720</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/LouisSimoneau" class="UserMention">@LouisSimoneau</a> </li>

<li>Custom assistant model selection not working <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5327" data-id="5327" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5327</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/aurele" class="UserMention">@aurele</a></li>
<li>When custom instructions say to search from web, the AI doesn't  <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5093" data-id="5093" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5093</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/miicat_47" class="UserMention">@miicat_47</a></li>
<li>Poor/inconsistent scrolling experience on mobile assistant w/ code blocks <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5163" data-id="5163" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5163</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Jesal" class="UserMention">@Jesal</a></li>
<li>Provide prompt before uploading files in assistant <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4217" data-id="4217" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4217</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/stevek" class="UserMention">@stevek</a></li>
<li>Assistant is slow (intermittent) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5216" data-id="5216" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5216</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/coreyward" class="UserMention">@coreyward</a></li>
<li>When clicking the Assistant retry button, it sends me to the top of page <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5231" data-id="5231" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5231</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/beetstabasco" class="UserMention">@beetstabasco</a></li>
<li>Opens assistant twice? <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5380" data-id="5380" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5380</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Temanor" class="UserMention">@Temanor</a></li>
<li>Remove GPT 4 and GPT 4 Turbo <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5182" data-id="5182" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5182</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/azdanov" class="UserMention">@azdanov</a></li></ul>

<h2>This week on social media</h2>

<p>Connect with us on social media! Tag our account or use #Kagi to share your thoughts and join the conversation.</p>

<p>Here is this week's featured social media <a href="https://mas.to/@scvalex/113455883944153930" rel="ugc nofollow">mention</a>:</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-11-15/1731710956-863358-28-new.png" title="" alt=""></p>
</content>

entries.description:
Image search becomes even better !

We're excited to roll out major upgrades to our image search. This release includes:

  • Our image search became even better with the inclusion of two more sources: Yandex Image Search (widely recognized as one of best image search services) and Openverse (vast collection of openly licensed images). Kagi is doing the hard work so that you don't have to.

  • Enhanced generative AI image detection and flagging (first version of which we launched last month)

  • A revamped preview pane with included reverse image search functionality

With this we believe we can say that Kagi has the most powerful image search on the web.

FastFeedParser - high performance library for processing feeds

We open sourced FastFeedParser, a high performance RSS, Atom and RDF parser in Python.

This library powers Kagi Small Web and a few other initiatives at Kagi and is 10x-100x faster and more efficient at parsing feeds than existing alternatives.

FastFeedParser joins over a dozen Kagi open-source software projects.

Improvements and Bug Fixes

Kagi Translate

Two weeks ago we launched Kagi Translate to raving reviews and great reception.

We have a number of improvements and more is scheduled.

  • Added PWA manifest so you can add Kagi Translate your home screen while we are developing the app
  • Switch language button also switches text
  • Fixed parsing for some websites
entries.title: Nov 19th, 2024 - Enhanced Image Search & Open Sourcing FastFeedParser

entries.author: Luis

content.value:
<content xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" type="html"><h2>Announcing Kagi Translate</h2>

<p><video controls="" src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-11-07/1731001661-291063-translate-v1-final.mov"></video></p>

<p>Never get lost in translation again. Today, we <a href="https://blog.kagi.com/kagi-translate" rel="ugc nofollow">launch Kagi Translate</a>, offering superior translations across 244 languages.</p>

<p>Key features:</p>
<ul><li>Higher quality translations than Google Translate and DeepL</li>
<li>Zero tracking, no apps needed</li>
<li>Free for everyone (Kagi members get captcha-free access)</li></ul>

<p>Try it now at <a href="https://translate.kagi.com" rel="ugc nofollow">translate.kagi.com</a> or read the <a href="https://blog.kagi.com/kagi-translate" rel="ugc nofollow">announcement post</a>.</p>


<h3>Kagi on mobile</h3>

<p>We've added search buttons to our homepage to make it easier for you to choose your search type on mobile:</p>


<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-11-07/1731006937-665097-screenshot-2024-11-07-at-111504.png" title="" alt=""></p>



<p>Install <a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kagi.search&amp;hl=en" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi for Android</a> and help us reach 5,000 installs needed for Kagi to submit application for Android choice screen.</p>

<p>Kagi iOS app is currently pending Apple review.</p>

<h3>What else are we working on?</h3>

<p>We are currently working on <strong>Kagi for Teams</strong> plan. This will allow you to bring your entire team or organization to Kagi. We'll have two options available: Professional and Ultimate tier, with fair and flexible pricing (inactive team members do not pay). We expect to launch in two weeks. Let us know if you would like to test this earlier by emailing <a href="mailto:support@kagi.com">support@kagi.com</a>.</p>



<h3>Improvements and bug fixes</h3>
<ul><li>Text overlay on the result page <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5060" data-id="5060" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5060</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/kagibacklit007" class="UserMention">@kagibacklit007</a></li>
<li>Hyperlink directly to specific assistants <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5254" data-id="5254" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5254</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/theDoctor" class="UserMention">@theDoctor</a></li>
<li>Possible issue with site searches <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3680" data-id="3680" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3680</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/kagi-nulvoid" class="UserMention">@kagi-nulvoid</a></li>
<li>Shield icon shows tracker warning, but popup does not. <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3177" data-id="3177" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3177</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Value7609" class="UserMention">@Value7609</a></li>
<li>Search suggestions for snaps replace @ with ! <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5187" data-id="5187" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5187</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/KamilKurde" class="UserMention">@KamilKurde</a></li>
<li>Make it more obvious that lenses can be reordered by dragging in the settings <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4607" data-id="4607" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4607</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/laiz" class="UserMention">@laiz</a></li>
<li>The movie/TV show widget has an unnecessary tooltip for the Rotten Tomatoes icon <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4605" data-id="4605" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4605</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/laiz" class="UserMention">@laiz</a></li>
<li>Allow different URL for snaps and bangs <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5224" data-id="5224" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5224</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/wigwagwent" class="UserMention">@wigwagwent</a></li>
<li>Maps Infobox shows incorrect information <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4950" data-id="4950" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4950</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/xjc" class="UserMention">@xjc</a></li>
<li>Typing "bala" surfaces Wikipedia suggestion with NSFW image <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4650" data-id="4650" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4650</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tuesday" class="UserMention">@tuesday</a></li>
<li>Poor iPadOS search results page scaling when multitasking  <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4582" data-id="4582" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4582</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Jake-Moss" class="UserMention">@Jake-Moss</a></li>
<li>Unclosable error dialog breaks android app <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4977" data-id="4977" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4977</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/onlymee" class="UserMention">@onlymee</a></li>
<li>Search engine bangs don't work in Safari <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5144" data-id="5144" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5144</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Ninja" class="UserMention">@Ninja</a></li>
<li>Unsaved prompt <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5195" data-id="5195" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5195</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/2STI" class="UserMention">@2STI</a></li>
<li>Add images to chat's in Assistant <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4728" data-id="4728" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4728</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>
<li>Kagi assistant - LLM choice in the URL <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4680" data-id="4680" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4680</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Krmloo" class="UserMention">@Krmloo</a></li>
<li>Can’t stop autoscroll while Assistant is generating <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5116" data-id="5116" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5116</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/artemvmin" class="UserMention">@artemvmin</a></li>
<li>Kagi Assistant "Remove Quick Access" button is not translated <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5286" data-id="5286" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5286</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/MonoMatrix" class="UserMention">@MonoMatrix</a></li>
<li>Can’t stop autoscroll while Assistant is generating <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5116" data-id="5116" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5116</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/artemvmin" class="UserMention">@artemvmin</a></li>
<li>New Assistant Sometimes Switches to the Code Custom Profile <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4808" data-id="4808" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4808</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/silvenga" class="UserMention">@silvenga</a></li></ul>

<h4>Bangs</h4>
<p>This release includes several new bangs and a significant cleanup of older ones. You can read the full <a href="https://github.com/kagisearch/bangs/releases" rel="ugc nofollow">changelog here</a>. These changes were <strong>driven by our community</strong>, and we appreciate all <a href="https://github.com/kagisearch/bangs" rel="ugc nofollow">contributions to our open source Bangs repo</a>!<br>
Here's a preview of our latest additions:</p>
<ul><li><code>!attack</code>: search site:attack.mitre.org</li>
<li><code>!jsr</code>: jsr.io</li>
<li><code>!fast</code>: moved to <a href="https://kagi.com/fastgpt" rel="ugc nofollow">FastGPT</a></li>
<li><code>!javadoc</code>: Java 23 API docs, docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/23/docs/api/search</li>
<li><code>!startech</code>: startech.com</li>
<li>dropout: dropout.tv</li></ul>


<h4>Kagi in the wild</h4>

<p>Here is this week's featured social media mention:</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-11-07/1731002395-214504-bluesky-post.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>Tag our account or use <strong>#Kagi</strong> when mentioning us in your posts!</p>
</content>

entries.description:
Announcing Kagi Translate

Never get lost in translation again. Today, we launch Kagi Translate, offering superior translations across 244 languages.

Key features:

  • Higher quality translations than Google Translate and DeepL
  • Zero tracking, no apps needed
  • Free for everyone (Kagi members get captcha-free access)

Try it now at translate.kagi.com or read the announcement post.

Kagi on mobile

We've added search buttons to our homepage to make it easier for you to choose your search type on mobile:

Install Kagi for Android and help us reach 5,000 installs needed for Kagi to submit application for Android choice screen.

Kagi iOS app is currently pending Apple review.

What else are we working on?

We are currently working on Kagi for Teams plan. This will allow you to bring your entire team or organization to Kagi. We'll have two options available: Professional and Ultimate tier, with fair and flexible pricing (inactive team members do not pay). We expect to launch in two weeks. Let us know if you would like to test this earlier by emailing support@kagi.com.

Improvements and bug fixes

  • Text overlay on the result page #5060 @kagibacklit007
  • Hyperlink directly to specific assistants #5254 @theDoctor
  • Possible issue with site searches #3680 @kagi-nulvoid
  • Shield icon shows tracker warning, but popup does not. #3177 @Value7609
  • Search suggestions
entries.title: Nov 7th, 2024 - Announcing Kagi Translate

entries.author: Luis

content.value:
<content xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" type="html">
<h3>Leveling up our infrastructure</h3>

<p>This Sunday at 6am UTC, we're making a step forward on our production infrastructure.</p>

<p>After years of faithful service, our original database server is being replaced with significantly more powerful hardware.</p>

<p>Expected downtime: 10 minutes</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-24/1729808541-783997-screenshot-2024-10-24-at-152218.png" title="" alt=""></p>



<h3>Protecting young minds: Enhanced video safety for families</h3>

<p>Your children deserve better than clickbait and shock value. We're making it happen with advanced video controls.</p>

<p><a href="https://help.kagi.com/kagi/plans/family-plan.html" rel="ugc nofollow">Family account</a> owners can now shape a safer, cleaner video experience for family members:</p>

<p><strong>Authentic thumbnails</strong></p>
<ul><li>Replace misleading clickbait with actual video screenshots</li>
<li>See what you're really getting before clicking</li>
<li>End the bait-and-switch</li></ul>

<p><strong>Clean video titles</strong></p>
<ul><li>Choose between title case or lowercase formatting</li>
<li>Create a consistent, distraction-free experience</li>
<li>Focus on content, not hype</li></ul>

<p>Example (click to enlarge):</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-24/1729800808-872205-image.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>To access these options, navigate to: <code>Settings &gt; Parental Controls (section: Video Search Settings)</code> or <a href="https://kagi.com/settings?p=account_settings" rel="ugc nofollow">click here</a>.</p>


<h4>Why this matters</h4>

<p><a href="https://medicine.umich.edu/dept/pediatrics/news/archive/202405/children-often-exposed-problematic-clickbait-during-youtube-searches" rel="ugc nofollow">Recent research</a> confirms a disturbing truth: children's video searches frequently expose them to inappropriate content, violence, and frightening images. We believe our children deserve better. Kagi's new parental controls help parents better manage the video content their children are exposed to, reducing the risk of exposure to inappropriate content and creating a safer online experience for them.</p>

<p>Help us protect more young minds - <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/" rel="ugc nofollow">share your thoughts</a> on making this protection <strong>available more broadly</strong> to all plan types. In case you wonder why we did not make this option enabled by default -  video thumbnails and titles serve as a marketing tools for content creators, and changing them unilaterally would introduce us as a biased intermediary on a matter that is still in the air. This could have a negative impact for publishers and potentially conflict with our mission to "humanize the web". It is a delicate issue, and this is why we had propagated the control over this to the user level, as with all personalization features in Kagi.</p>

<h3>Custom Assistant Bangs</h3>

<p>Launch your Custom Assistant instantly from anywhere with a Bang shortcut. Simply set your preferred command and you're ready to go.</p>

<p>This seamless integration means your Assistant is always just a keystroke away, whether you're researching, writing, or exploring new ideas.</p>



<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-24/1729797950-600057-image.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<h3>Improvements and bug fixes</h3>
<ul><li>We fixed many issues causing interruptions with the Assistant. please let us know if you see any further issues.</li>
<li>Standalone bang shortcut ignores snap <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5083" data-id="5083" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5083</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tuesday" class="UserMention">@tuesday</a> </li>
<li>Timer shown for unrelated query <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4103" data-id="4103" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4103</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/azdanov" class="UserMention">@azdanov</a></li>
<li>Duplicate video results <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4306" data-id="4306" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4306</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/loloriz" class="UserMention">@loloriz</a> </li>
<li>Z-index on icon covers tooltip <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4849" data-id="4849" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4849</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/bebowilson" class="UserMention">@bebowilson</a></li>
<li>Custom bangs that override builtin bangs no longer work <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5148" data-id="5148" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5148</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/avkiselev" class="UserMention">@avkiselev</a></li>
<li>Focus address field after clicking reverse image search button <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4906" data-id="4906" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4906</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tuesday" class="UserMention">@tuesday</a></li>
<li>Override the ai downranking if you are searching ai images <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5082" data-id="5082" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5082</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>
<li>Quick answer weird code block formatting <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4770" data-id="4770" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4770</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/timo" class="UserMention">@timo</a> </li>
<li>Background for Advanced search in dark mode is too light <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4586" data-id="4586" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4586</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/eirk" class="UserMention">@eirk</a></li>
<li>Keep focus on the search field upon accepting suggestion <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4973" data-id="4973" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4973</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/xdc" class="UserMention">@xdc</a></li>
<li>Pricing page translation typo <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4596" data-id="4596" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4596</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Albi" class="UserMention">@Albi</a> </li>
<li>!gflights incorrect target <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5132" data-id="5132" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5132</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Connor" class="UserMention">@Connor</a></li>
<li>Untimely redirect when typing a verse <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5107" data-id="5107" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5107</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/X145678908765" class="UserMention">@X145678908765</a> </li>
<li>Assistant: Option to use Shift+Enter to send prompt instead of just Enter <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/2121" data-id="2121" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#2121</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Value7609" class="UserMention">@Value7609</a> </li>
<li>Enhancement Request: Customizable Multiple AI Assistant Prompts with User-Defined !bang Commands <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/2183" data-id="2183" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#2183</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/ZarK" class="UserMention">@ZarK</a> </li>
<li>Assistant input text box stubbornly places itself under the keyboard <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4902" data-id="4902" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4902</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/gunslingerfry" class="UserMention">@gunslingerfry</a></li>
<li>New Assistant - Touch Issues on Mobile (Dynamic Viewport Resizing, Covering Sources) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4835" data-id="4835" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4835</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/silvenga" class="UserMention">@silvenga</a></li>
<li>Microphone on assistant doesn't work <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5105" data-id="5105" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5105</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sleepysnooze" class="UserMention">@sleepysnooze</a></li>
<li>Assistant web search gets stuck <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5025" data-id="5025" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5025</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/azdanov" class="UserMention">@azdanov</a></li>
<li>Typo in the FAQ <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5079" data-id="5079" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5079</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/duck" class="UserMention">@duck</a></li></ul>



<h4>Join the Kagi revolution in the wild!</h4>

<p>Here are all the cool places you can find us at:</p>

<ul><li><a href="https://twitter.com/KagiHQ" rel="ugc nofollow">KagiHQ on X</a></li>
<li><a href="https://mastodon.social/@KagiHQ" rel="ugc nofollow">KagiHQ on Mastodon</a></li>
<li><a href="https://bsky.app/profile/kagi.com" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi.com on Bluesky</a></li>
<li><a href="https://threads.net/@kagihq" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi.com on Threads</a></li>
<li><a href="https://instagram.com/kagihq" rel="ugc nofollow">KagiHQ on Instagram</a></li></ul>

<p>Use <strong>#Kagi</strong> when mentioning us in your posts! Which brings us to this week's featured post from social media:</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-24/1729807957-474875-screenshot-2024-10-24-at-151225.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>We also have a <a href="https://kagi.com/discord" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Community Discord server</a> where you can join our community for real-time discussion about the product and chat with other Kagi users. There is also <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/SearchKagi/" rel="ugc nofollow">/r/SearchKagi on Reddit</a> - steadily growing unofficial community.</p>

<p>Thank you for being a vital part of our journey - your support inspires us every day, and we can’t wait to see where this adventure takes us next! 🙏</p> </content>

After years of faithful service, our original database server is being replaced with significantly more powerful hardware.

Expected downtime: 10 minutes

Protecting young minds: Enhanced video safety for families

Your children deserve better than clickbait and shock value. We're making it happen with advanced video controls.

content.value:
<content xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" type="html">
<h4>Better image search with AI-generated images detection</h4>

<p>Last week we got quite clear and <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4972-ability-to-filter-out-obvious-ai-image-websites-from-image-search" rel="ugc nofollow">direct feedback</a> that we need to do something about AI-generated images that started creeping up in the image search.</p>

<p>You asked for it and we delivered!</p>

<p>We are enhancing our image search with a new ranking algorithm and an AI image filter. These updates prioritise authentic, human-created images and downrank AI-generated content. Users can also opt to exclude AI-generated images entirely.</p>

<p>Learn more about Kagi's AI image filter here: <a href="https://help.kagi.com/kagi/features/exclude-ai-images.html" rel="ugc nofollow">https://help.kagi.com/kagi/features/exclude-ai-images.html</a></p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-17/1729194595-631881-image-search-ai-labelf8dce12e.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>We will continue actively improving this feature based on your feedback.</p>

<h3>Improvements and bug fixes</h3>
<ul><li>Ability to filter out obvious ai image websites from Image search <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4972" data-id="4972" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4972</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>
<li>Snaps not working with automatic quick answer <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5022" data-id="5022" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5022</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Jesal" class="UserMention">@Jesal</a> </li>
<li>No margin between clear and question mark <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5031" data-id="5031" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5031</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/azdanov" class="UserMention">@azdanov</a></li>
<li>Link for most blocked domains missing in new kagi website <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4746" data-id="4746" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4746</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sw" class="UserMention">@sw</a></li>
<li>Quick answer <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5061" data-id="5061" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5061</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/TheBOT" class="UserMention">@TheBOT</a> </li>
<li>Dark mode doesn't adapt <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5013" data-id="5013" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5013</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/greyfivenine8244" class="UserMention">@greyfivenine8244</a></li>
<li>Support time shorthands on timer widget <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3444" data-id="3444" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3444</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sefidel" class="UserMention">@sefidel</a></li></ul>

<h4>The Assistant</h4>
<ul><li>We've enhanced the Assistant mobile experience with several updates, including improvements to the thread view and header navigation</li>
<li>Kagi Assistant v2 mobile threads menu <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4725" data-id="4725" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4725</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/frin" class="UserMention">@frin</a></li>
<li>Kagi assistant gpt LLM not working <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5055" data-id="5055" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5055</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/ash" class="UserMention">@ash</a> </li>
<li>Assistant Tooltips are Hard to Click <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5037" data-id="5037" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5037</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/silvenga" class="UserMention">@silvenga</a></li> </ul>

<h4>Celebrating Our Community</h4>

<p>At Kagi, we’re all about community, and nothing has made us prouder than seeing the incredible photos our members are sharing online of their Kagi swag! Whether you’ve posted a picture of your free t-shirt or a sticker proudly displayed on your laptop, we want to take a moment to say thank you. Your support means the world to us.</p>

<p><strong>The story:</strong></p>

<p>We were thrilled to celebrate our first big milestone: <a href="https://blog.kagi.com/celebrating-20k" rel="ugc nofollow">reaching 20,000 loyal members</a> who’ve stuck with us through this adventure. To show our appreciation, we've sent out free t-shirts and sticker packs to those first 20,000 supporters. Earlier this month, these members started receiving their packages and excitedly shared photos across various socials. Here’s a snapshot of just a few:</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-17/1729193189-984221-kagi-collage.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>For anyone who missed out, don’t worry! You can head over to the <a href="https://store.kagi.com/" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Store</a> and snag your first-edition Doggo t-shirt. We’ve got four fantastic designs, each one representing our determination to build a better, more ethical and more human web.</p>

<h4>Help us reach our next milestone: 50,000 members</h4>

<p>As we gear up to reach 50,000 <a href="https://kagi.com/stats?stat=members" rel="ugc nofollow">members</a>, we’d love your help in spreading the word!</p>

<p>We don't rely on ads to drive our growth; instead, we depend entirely on word-of-mouth marketing and community recommendations. This grassroots approach means that every conversation you have about Kagi, every post you share showcasing your swag, and every mention you make to friends and family has a real impact. Your enthusiasm helps us reach new members who share our vision for a better web. Let’s make our next milestone one to remember.</p>

<h4>Where to find and tag us on the social web:</h4>
<ul><li><a href="https://twitter.com/KagiHQ" rel="ugc nofollow">KagiHQ on X</a></li>
<li><a href="https://mastodon.social/@KagiHQ" rel="ugc nofollow">KagiHQ on Mastodon</a></li>
<li><a href="https://bsky.app/profile/kagi.com" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi.com on Bluesky</a></li>
<li><a href="https://threads.net/@kagihq" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi.com on Threads</a></li>
<li><a href="https://instagram.com/kagihq" rel="ugc nofollow">KagiHQ on Instagram</a></li></ul>

<p>We also have a <a href="https://kagi.com/discord" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Community Discord server</a> where you can join our community for real-time discussion about the product and chat with other Kagi users.</p>

<p>As we move forward, we want to reiterate our commitment to continuously improving Kagi for all our members. Your <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/" rel="ugc nofollow">feedback</a> and engagement are invaluable as we strive to create an even better experience. Thank you for being a vital part of our journey - your support inspires us every day, and we can’t wait to see where this adventure takes us next!</p></content>

entries.description:
Better image search with AI-generated images detection

Last week we got quite clear and direct feedback that we need to do something about AI-generated images that started creeping up in the image search.

You asked for it and we delivered!

We are enhancing our image search with a new ranking algorithm and an AI image filter. These updates prioritise authentic, human-created images and downrank AI-generated content. Users can also opt to exclude AI-generated images entirely.

Learn more about Kagi's AI image filter here: https://help.kagi.com/kagi/features/exclude-ai-images.html

We will continue actively improving this feature based on your feedback.

Improvements and bug fixes

  • Ability to filter out obvious ai image websites from Image search #4972 @Thibaultmol
  • Snaps not working with automatic quick answer #5022 @Jesal
  • No margin between clear and question mark #5031 @azdanov
  • Link for most blocked domains missing in new kagi website #4746 @sw
  • Quick answer #5061 @TheBOT
  • Dark mode doesn't adapt #5013 @greyfivenine8244
  • Support time shorthands on timer widget #3444 @sefidel

The Assistant

  • We've enhanced the Assistant mobile experience with several updates, including improvements to the thread view and header navigation
  • Kagi Assistant v2 mobile threads menu #4725 @frin
  • Kagi assistant gpt LLM not working
entries.title: October 17th, 2024 - AI-generated image filter in search results

entries.author: Luis

content.value:
<content xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" type="html">
<p>Hello, Kagi Fans!</p>

<p>We know it's been a few weeks since our last update, and there's a good reason for that. The entire company took a break from the usual routine to fly to Barcelona, Spain, for our annual retreat - a chance to reenergize and refocus for the exciting journey ahead.</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-05/1728090499-177024-kagi-team.jpg" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>But don’t worry, it wasn’t all fun and no work. In fact, we’ve got a pretty exciting update for you today. The retreat gave us fresh inspiration, and we’re ready to bring some of those new ideas to life starting right now.</p>

<h2>Launching the official Kagi Android app</h2>

<p>We're delighted to announce the launch of the <a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kagi.search&amp;hl=en_US" rel="ugc nofollow">official Kagi Android app!</a> This marks an important milestone in our mission to make Kagi Search more accessible and encourage more people to try it out.</p>

<p><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kagi.search" rel="ugc nofollow">https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kagi.search</a></p>

<p>The app allows users to begin using Kagi Search immediately right from the first launch (<strong>no account needed</strong>!). For those with existing subscriptions, signing in is seamless, enabling access to all Kagi features.</p>

<p>Additionally, the app includes <strong>native homescreen widgets</strong>, providing one-click access to search directly from your homescreen.</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-10/1728592468-556003-image.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p>If you use an Android device, go check it out! We've simplified the process of sharing Kagi with your network.</p>

<p>Additionally, a recent <a href="https://www.android.com/choicescreen/dma/" rel="ugc nofollow">EU ruling</a> presents a significant opportunity for Kagi. Google is now required to include any search engine that meets <a href="https://www.android.com/choicescreen/dma/searchengine/" rel="ugc nofollow">specific criteria</a>, such as having an app with <strong>over 5,000 installs</strong>, in the default list for Android and Chrome — <a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kagi.search" rel="ugc nofollow">install the app</a> today and help us meet the criteria!</p>

<p>Stay tuned for more exciting updates coming soon!</p>

<h2>Introducing Snaps</h2>

<p><a href="https://help.kagi.com/kagi/features/snaps.html" rel="ugc nofollow">Snaps</a> are an innovative search operator that allows for site-specific searches directly from the search bar. By simply typing <code>@</code> followed by the designated <a href="https://help.kagi.com/kagi/features/bangs.html" rel="ugc nofollow">site bang</a>, you can limit your search results to a specific website. For example, to search on Reddit or HackerNews, you can enter:</p>
<ul><li><code>@r winter boots</code> which translates to <code>winter boots site:www.reddit.com</code></li>
<li>and <code>@hn vim emacs</code> to <code>vim emacs site:news.ycombinator.com</code></li></ul>

<p>This feature was made possible thanks to the contribution of our user <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tuesday" class="UserMention">@tuesday</a> ( <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/1231" data-id="1231" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#1231</span></a>) on <a href="https://kagifeedback.org" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagifeedback</a>!</p>

<p>This will work with any bang that Kagi support, including custom bangs you define. <a href="https://github.com/kagisearch/bangs" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Bangs</a> are open source, we welcome your contributions!</p>

<h2>Universal Summarizer for Chrome</h2>

 <p><a href="https://kagi.com/summarizer" rel="ugc nofollow">Universal Summarizer</a> is one of the most-loved Kagi treats. The extension is now available for Chrome -  <strong><a href="https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/kagi-summarizer/dpaefegpjhgeplnkomgbcmmlffkijbgp" rel="ugc nofollow">Download it here!</a></strong></p>

<p>We had to split it out of Kagi Search extension for Chrome due to rules of the Chrome store. Kagi Universal Summarizer is available to Firefox users via <a href="https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/kagi-search-for-firefox/" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Search for Firefox</a> and is natively built into the <a href="https://kagi.com/orion" rel="ugc nofollow">Orion browser</a>.</p>

<h2>The Assistant - 30 day update</h2>

<p>It's been 30 days since we launched the Assistant, and we're excited to share a range of new updates with you.</p>

<p><strong>Upload functionality</strong>: <br>
We're excited to announce that you can now <strong>upload a variety of local files directly to the Assistant</strong>! This new feature allows you to <strong>add multiple files in a single prompt</strong>. Here's a list of supported file types:</p>
<ul><li>Text files: .txt, .md</li>
<li>Rich text documents: .pdf, .docx, .pptx</li>
<li>Tabular data files: .json, .csv, .xlsx, ...</li>
<li>Images: .jpeg, .png, .webp, ... </li>
<li>Audio files: .mp3, .wav, .m4a, ... <br>
<img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-11/1728670037-180584-image.png" title="" alt=""></li></ul>

<p>Additionally, you can <strong>add a URL</strong> to have its contents summarised or to pose questions about it.</p>

<p><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-11/1728660555-886127-image.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p><strong>Stop button</strong><br>
We've introduced a Stop button that allows users to immediately halt the Assistant's streaming output. <br>
<img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-08/1728393487-484837-image.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<p><strong>Mobile improvements</strong><br>
And also made several enhancements to our mobile experience, and there's even more on the way!<br>
<img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-10-11/1728668293-62610-image.png" title="" alt=""></p>

<h3>Plus many other Assistant improvements</h3>
<ul><li>Give assistant a PWA manifest <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4734" data-id="4734" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4734</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>
<li>Add Stop button for AI assistants <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4034" data-id="4034" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4034</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/andrew-rivera" class="UserMention">@andrew-rivera</a></li>
<li>Multiline assistant queries on mobile <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4693" data-id="4693" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4693</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/fxgn" class="UserMention">@fxgn</a></li>
<li>Added <code>Llama405b</code> model to the list of available models in the Assistant</li>
<li>Assistant v2 Text Input Form increases with use <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4799" data-id="4799" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4799</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/DaJonas" class="UserMention">@DaJonas</a></li>
<li>Session Link for Kagi Assistant <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4772" data-id="4772" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4772</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/melomac" class="UserMention">@melomac</a></li>
<li>Assistant V2 initial prompt text field doesn't scroll <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4739" data-id="4739" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4739</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>
<li>Kagi Assistant UI Issues <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4729" data-id="4729" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4729</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/emptyjar" class="UserMention">@emptyjar</a></li>
<li>Browsing to <a href="https://kagi.com/assistant" rel="ugc nofollow">https://kagi.com/assistant</a> when not logged in results in 404 <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4765" data-id="4765" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4765</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/cmart" class="UserMention">@cmart</a></li>
<li>[firefox] text box in assistant text box can display funny at wrap point <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4002" data-id="4002" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4002</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sbeckeriv" class="UserMention">@sbeckeriv</a></li>
<li>Universal summarizer can't find transcript: yet finds transcript for slightly different URL edition <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4451" data-id="4451" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4451</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/leftium" class="UserMention">@leftium</a></li>
<li>Assistant history vanishes temporarily after branching <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4686" data-id="4686" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4686</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Value7609" class="UserMention">@Value7609</a> </li>
<li>Assistant v2. Custom LLM settings not persistent. <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4672" data-id="4672" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4672</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/flokerama" class="UserMention">@flokerama</a></li>
<li>New Assistant Beta looks bad in Safari <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4675" data-id="4675" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4675</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Rudotel" class="UserMention">@Rudotel</a> </li>
<li>Assistant does not respect lens when searching <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4756" data-id="4756" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4756</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/double" class="UserMention">@double</a></li>
<li>Assistant - Broked Fonts <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4837" data-id="4837" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4837</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/silvenga" class="UserMention">@silvenga</a></li>
<li>Assistant not respecting multiple lines.  <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4764" data-id="4764" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4764</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tombert" class="UserMention">@tombert</a></li>

<li>Assistant (V2): make the 'send' button in the chat gray as long as the llm is still 'typing' <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4738" data-id="4738" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4738</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>

<li>Model name is intersecting the assistant answer on mobile <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4694" data-id="4694" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4694</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/fxgn" class="UserMention">@fxgn</a></li>
<li>Completely innacurate assistant context <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4667" data-id="4667" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4667</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tinkling6961" class="UserMention">@tinkling6961</a> </li>
<li>Assistant - Inconsistant "New Tab" Behavior <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4909" data-id="4909" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4909</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/silvenga" class="UserMention">@silvenga</a></li>

<li>Assisant 'internet=off' is ignored <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4965" data-id="4965" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4965</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>
<li>The buttons on the bottom of a thread (copy, regenerate, info) shouldn't be inactive depending on how far you scrolled <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4831" data-id="4831" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4831</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/chris_20017" class="UserMention">@chris_20017</a> </li>
<li>Assistant v2 Text Input Form increases with use <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4799" data-id="4799" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4799</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/DaJonas" class="UserMention">@DaJonas</a></li>

<li>Code font is giant on phone for assistant <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4797" data-id="4797" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4797</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tombert" class="UserMention">@tombert</a></li>

<li>Assistant V2beta character display error <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4673" data-id="4673" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4673</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/OxygenX" class="UserMention">@OxygenX</a></li>
<li>Assistant thread UI buttons on Firefox mobile don't work <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4805" data-id="4805" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4805</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/tinkling6961" class="UserMention">@tinkling6961</a> </li>
<li>Paste an image in research assistant to chat about it <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4028" data-id="4028" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4028</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/hadario" class="UserMention">@hadario</a></li>
<li>The Assistant input box isn't cleared when submitting a prompt using the microphone if the device keyboard has been used <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4923" data-id="4923" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4923</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/laiz" class="UserMention">@laiz</a></li>
<li>Copy the search prompt to the assistant prompt when "The Assistant" button is clicked on the search page <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5005" data-id="5005" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5005</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/webwalrus" class="UserMention">@webwalrus</a></li></ul>


<h2>Search improvements and bug fixes</h2>
<ul><li>New users can now register for Kagi using their GitHub credentials</li>
<li>Sort news articles by time <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/142" data-id="142" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#142</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Kai" class="UserMention">@Kai</a></li>
<li>"News" doesn't use the browser preferred language <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/589" data-id="589" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#589</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/cbaconnier" class="UserMention">@cbaconnier</a></li>
<li>Suddenly images are always using SafeSearch, even when disabled. <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4560" data-id="4560" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4560</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/ShadowKGI" class="UserMention">@ShadowKGI</a></li>
<li>Exclude site from search works very inconsistently <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4627" data-id="4627" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4627</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/dantheman" class="UserMention">@dantheman</a></li>
<li>Inform user on misspelled words <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3029" data-id="3029" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3029</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/null" class="UserMention">@null</a></li>
<li>No code snippets in Europe <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3559" data-id="3559" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3559</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/NevevrAlak" class="UserMention">@NevevrAlak</a></li>
<li>Duplicate search results on case-insensitive sites (e.g. GitHub) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/2071" data-id="2071" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#2071</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/pawo2500" class="UserMention">@pawo2500</a></li>
<li>Prefixing @ (the at symbol) to a query doesnt give a results page (redirects to home) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4951" data-id="4951" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4951</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/ChristenGottschlich" class="UserMention">@ChristenGottschlich</a></li>
<li>Summarizer "ask questions about page" chat cannot determine authors of papers from PubMed <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4594" data-id="4594" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4594</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Nashwan" class="UserMention">@Nashwan</a></li>
<li>Phone number recognized as a fedex tracking number <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4541" data-id="4541" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4541</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Ronzino" class="UserMention">@Ronzino</a></li>
<li>Searching "Hunter S. Thompson" gives at-a-glance results for Oscar Zeta Acosta <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4714" data-id="4714" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4714</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/UndarkAido" class="UserMention">@UndarkAido</a></li>
<li>Visit website button is not clearly visible in light mode <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4550" data-id="4550" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4550</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/astronaut" class="UserMention">@astronaut</a></li>
<li>‘Showing results for’ has weird padding <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4644" data-id="4644" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4644</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sefidel" class="UserMention">@sefidel</a></li>
<li>Language Error in Popup <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4899" data-id="4899" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4899</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/greyfivenine8244" class="UserMention">@greyfivenine8244</a></li>
<li>Safe search and safe image search are not about privacy <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4892" data-id="4892" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4892</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/slamor" class="UserMention">@slamor</a></li>
<li>Add British English (en_GB) locale <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4615" data-id="4615" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4615</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sefidel" class="UserMention">@sefidel</a></li>
<li>IP Address Widget Fails to Resolve IPv4 Address <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4239" data-id="4239" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4239</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/silvenga" class="UserMention">@silvenga</a></li>
<li>Wolfram info button goes on top of search suggestions <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4678" data-id="4678" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4678</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sefidel" class="UserMention">@sefidel</a></li>
<li>US news result mentioning Poland caused response to be in Polish <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4589" data-id="4589" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4589</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/yokoffing" class="UserMention">@yokoffing</a></li>
<li>Custom bang names with colons fail to render past the colon on the edit page <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4777" data-id="4777" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4777</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/kenk" class="UserMention">@kenk</a></li>
<li>Inform user on misspelled words <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/3029" data-id="3029" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#3029</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/null" class="UserMention">@null</a></li>
<li>FastGPT No Longer Cites Sources <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4840" data-id="4840" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4840</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/fish" class="UserMention">@fish</a></li>
<li>Universal Summarize does not summarize Yahoo Finance article <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4821" data-id="4821" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4821</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/yokoffing" class="UserMention">@yokoffing</a></li>
<li>Summary bang for specific language <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4954" data-id="4954" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4954</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Albi" class="UserMention">@Albi</a></li>
<li>Redirects parses URLs incorrectly when leaving out protocol <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4619" data-id="4619" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4619</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/utopia" class="UserMention">@utopia</a></li>
<li>Display title of summarized website <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4834" data-id="4834" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4834</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Wojtek" class="UserMention">@Wojtek</a></li>
<li>Repeated podcast results <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4683" data-id="4683" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4683</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/menturi" class="UserMention">@menturi</a></li>
<li>Scroll bar stutters in Kagi Summarzier  <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4628" data-id="4628" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4628</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Fracture" class="UserMention">@Fracture</a></li>
<li>Prefixing @ (the at symbol) to a query doesnt give a results page (redirects to home) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4951" data-id="4951" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4951</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/ChristenGottschlich" class="UserMention">@ChristenGottschlich</a></li>
<li>Broken currency formatting Thai Baht (฿) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4970" data-id="4970" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4970</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/MX5" class="UserMention">@MX5</a></li>
<li>Advanced Search info truncated on mobile <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4779" data-id="4779" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4779</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/jessemerriman" class="UserMention">@jessemerriman</a></li>
<li>Select elements don't work in Kagi settings (Safari 15.6.1) <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4565" data-id="4565" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4565</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/carl" class="UserMention">@carl</a> </li>
<li>Clickable images on Changelog <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4691" data-id="4691" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4691</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/dix" class="UserMention">@dix</a></li>
<li>Quick Answer does not always link sources <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4883" data-id="4883" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4883</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/menturi" class="UserMention">@menturi</a> </li>
<li>AI refers to system prompt <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4942" data-id="4942" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4942</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/maskmonarch" class="UserMention">@maskmonarch</a></li>
<li>Ability to filter out obvious ai image websites from Image search <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4972" data-id="4972" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4972</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Thibaultmol" class="UserMention">@Thibaultmol</a></li>

<li>Line height not correct <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4898" data-id="4898" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4898</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/greyfivenine8244" class="UserMention">@greyfivenine8244</a></li>
<li>Leaving the image gallery/view by pressing the X or esc requires several clicks/taps <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4839" data-id="4839" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4839</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/laiz" class="UserMention">@laiz</a></li>
<li>Searching with site:.TLD yields results from other TLDs <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4880" data-id="4880" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4880</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/campfire" class="UserMention">@campfire</a></li>
<li>The !scoop Bang has weird behaviour when left empty <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4963" data-id="4963" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4963</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/LucasOe" class="UserMention">@LucasOe</a></li>
<li>Repeated podcast results <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4683" data-id="4683" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4683</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/menturi" class="UserMention">@menturi</a></li>
<li>!cocoapods search is broken <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5011" data-id="5011" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5011</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/sidwolf6583" class="UserMention">@sidwolf6583</a> </li>
<li>502 Server Error whenever I try to modify a bang <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4960" data-id="4960" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4960</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/umar" class="UserMention">@umar</a></li>
<li>Clear button doesn't work on android app <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/5002" data-id="5002" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#5002</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/agustinfitipaldi" class="UserMention">@agustinfitipaldi</a> </li>
<li>Viewing individual search usage in a duo/family plan <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4597" data-id="4597" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4597</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/devilkin" class="UserMention">@devilkin</a></li>
<li>Dates are often wrong in search results &amp; filters <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/2603" data-id="2603" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#2603</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/Vapid" class="UserMention">@Vapid</a></li>
<li>Improvements to Kagi changelog <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/d/4913" data-id="4913" class="DiscussionMention"><span class="DiscussionMention-text">#4913</span></a> <a href="https://kagifeedback.org/u/laiz" class="UserMention">@laiz</a></li>

entries.description:
Hello, Kagi Fans!

We know it's been a few weeks since our last update, and there's a good reason for that. The entire company took a break from the usual routine to fly to Barcelona, Spain, for our annual retreat - a chance to reenergize and refocus for the exciting journey ahead.

But don’t worry, it wasn’t all fun and no work. In fact, we’ve got a pretty exciting update for you today. The retreat gave us fresh inspiration, and we’re ready to bring some of those new ideas to life starting right now.

Launching the official Kagi Android app

We're delighted to announce the launch of the official Kagi Android app! This marks an important milestone in our mission to make Kagi Search more accessible and encourage more people to try it out.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kagi.search

The app allows users to begin using Kagi Search immediately right from the first launch (no account needed!). For those with existing subscriptions, signing in is seamless, enabling access to all Kagi features.

Additionally, the app includes native homescreen widgets, providing one-click access to search directly from your homescreen.

If you use an Android device, go check it out! We've simplified the process of sharing Kagi with your network.

Additionally, a recent EU ruling presents a significant opportunity for Kagi. Google is now required to include any search engine that meets specific criteria, such as having an app with over 5,000
entries.title: October 11th, 2024 - Fresh from Barcelona: Android App, New Snaps Operator, Assistant Updates and More!

entries.author: Luis

content.value:
<content xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" type="html"><h1>Announcements</h1>

<h2>Kagi Store</h2>

<p><a href="https://store.kagi.com" rel="ugc nofollow">Kagi Store</a> is live! Grab your first edition Doggo t-shirt while the stock lasts.</p>

<p><a href="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-08-26/1724682275-627210-screenshot-2024-08-26-at-072414.png" rel="ugc nofollow"><img src="https://kagifeedback.org/assets/files/2024-08-26/1724682275-627210-screenshot-2024-08-26-at-072414.png" title="" alt=""></a></p>

<p>Getting this out of the door was quite a journey. We wrote a small blog post about it.</p>

<p><a href="https://blog.kagi.com/mountains-of-cotton" rel="ugc nofollow">We moved mountains (of cotton) to deliver on our promise</a></p>

<h2>The Assistant video commercial</h2>

<p>🎬 Drumroll, please... Our first video commercial celebrating the launch of <a href="https://blog.kagi.com/announcing-assistant" rel="ugc nofollow">The Assistant</a> is live, and we couldn’t be more thrilled and proud! Let us know what you think!</p>

<p><a href="https://youtu.be/Lznc7p43nos" rel="ugc nofollow">Check it out on YouTube!</a></p>

<h3>Improvements and Bug Fixes (minor update post the Assistant launch)</h3>
<ul><li>You can now open the Kagi Search that the Assistant performed throughout all different thread responses.</li>
<li>Internet access is correctly set when the last used model is a Custom Assistant</li>
<li>When branching, earlier messages no longer disappear</li>
<li>Fixed an issue that disabled mouse scroll in the prompt box when large prompts were used</li>
<li>Fixed an issue where using Assistant bangs such as <code>!code</code> with another Custom Assistant present prevented the model selection from loading</li>
<li>While we finish implementing custom bangs for Custom Assistants, you can already <a href="https://kagi.com/settings?p=custom_bangs" rel="ugc nofollow">create them manually</a> by using the <code>profile</code> query parameter in the Assistant URL. For example: <code>https://kagi.com/assistant?q=%s&amp;profile=id</code><br>
You'll find the Custom Assistant <code>id</code> in the URL when editing your Custom Assistant</li></ul></content>

Announcements

Kagi Store

Kagi Store is live! Grab your first edition Doggo t-shirt while the stock lasts.

Getting this out of the door was quite a journey. We wrote a small blog post about it.

We moved mountains (of cotton) to deliver on our promise

The Assistant video commercial

🎬 Drumroll, please... Our first video commercial celebrating the launch of The Assistant is live, and we couldn’t be more thrilled and proud! Let us know what you think!

Check it out on YouTube!

Improvements and Bug Fixes (minor update post the Assistant launch)

  • You can now open the Kagi Search that the Assistant performed throughout all different thread responses.
  • Internet access is correctly set when the last used model is a Custom Assistant
  • When branching, earlier messages no longer disappear
  • Fixed an issue that disabled mouse scroll in the prompt box when large prompts were used
  • Fixed an issue where using Assistant bangs such as !code with another Custom Assistant present prevented the model selection from loading
  • While we finish implementing custom bangs for Custom Assistants, you can already create them manually by using the profile query parameter in the Assistant URL. For example: https://kagi.com/assistant?q=%s&profile=id
    You'll find the Custom Assistant id in the URL when editing your Custom Assistant
